page.title: 01Walberswick.
page.content: Walberswick a unique village on the Suffolk coast, bounded on its northern side with heathland, grazing marshes and the harbour of the 'Blyte', with its Longmore fishing boats and pleasure craft. To the south of the village a great many acres of saltings growing reeds for thatching, and supporting many rare species of birds, to east is the north sea encroaching on the saltings at every scouring tide which pushes the sand and shingle bank slowly inland. The area abounds with footpaths to delight the walker, with fine views of heath, marsh and sea. Many houses have been brought to the village from elsewhere and rebuilt, also conversions from coach houses and garages along with standard houses giving a variety of architecture. Half the 250 houses in the village are used as holiday homes.
